title: At this point, I genuinely feel the Balance Team should be the next major Rework.
body:
Seriously. Who's even directing & paying you people? I'm sorry to be an ass, but this is **seriously** getting ridiculous.

Who in their right mind actually finds League as a whole "fun and engaging" right now? What happened to the people that wanted to avoid becoming DOTA, avoid absurd damage? What happened to the team that spouted on and on about how significant it was that a primary focus of balance & gameplay was to ensure it was **fun and engaging**?

#**Do you people seriously enjoy your own game right now??**

In fact, I'll make this easy; which of the following encourages **FUN AND ENGAGING** gameplay for allies as well as opposition?

- Substantial map-wide influence via Jungler role following 2nd-3rd camp clear [Lasts entire Laning Phase, very few fall off from doing this]
- Gold-farming Keystone with RNG consumables
- Majority of Marksmen requiring underpriced items to perform well
- AD Assassins relying on an overloaded & underpriced item to function
- Supports, the class known for 'empowering allies' bringing forth the strength of Solo-Lane Tanks/Carries
- Outer Towers falling from a single early push with Solo Laner + Jungler (possible at Level 5-7; sometimes Level 4)
- Effectively free mini-Zhonyas at 6 minutes; discouraging the fast-paced, kill-centric gameplay you've promoted since Season 6

I'd wager **REAL** money that you're leaning on quite a few variables (namely Duskblade, undertuned Zeal items, underpriced/overpowered Support items when synergizing with Runes) to avoid the struggles of balancing those hinging on the successful performance of these variables. **I've seen what the Balance Team is capable of in my time with LoL**, and I'd frankly like to know what the hell happened to them; because the lack of effort coming from you all goes *wayyyy* over my head.

**If you don't like how I'm expressing my frustration, I'm not sorry, because I genuinely think you should all be ashamed of not trying harder to balance around the factors that you've known for years creates fun and engaging gameplay -- rather than attempt an entirely different direction (arguably for the sake of shorter LCS games / higher number of LCS games in a shorter time frame).**

#You've tried it. And it's not working out. People aren't happy, and we just want the game to feel enjoyable for ourselves, our friends, and even our enemies on the Rift. Consider looking back on what raised you all so high up to begin with.

~~Don't delete my post, as I'm not calling for you to be fired. & This post may promote discussion.~~

You forgot the poor ap itemization that the just only started to address.

I stopped playing Solo/Duo queue because of this. 

You literally cannot solo carry anymore. If the rest of your lanes feed, that's it. There is so such thing as carrying anymore unless you're playing an extremely bursty midlane champ like Katerina, or a jungler like Yi who can just melt through multiple people in a matter of seconds. 

I can't tell you how many times I've won my lane bot, gotten my first turret, shat on my enemy laner and came out ahead, just to lose the game because mid or top fed, or because the enemy jungler was just "better".

Everytime I see post like this it comes down to one simple similarity.

You can't accept that teamwork is stronger then your solo plays regardless of the fact that you really really really want to win.

> Substantial map-wide influence via Jungler

What is a gank if not a very simple move to create a numbers advantage? Deal with it.

> Outer Towers falling from a single early push with Solo Laner + Jungler

2 v 1 again?

> AD Assassins relying on an overloaded & underpriced item to function [...]Supports, the class known for 'empowering allies'

Yeah you kinda ignore the core idea here which is that ADC's are only investing into damage and heavily rely on teamwork with their support or other frontliners, just like the support relies on having someone to support...so again it's teamwork and you only think of yourself.

The real problem is that you are decieving yourself if you think that your ideas fit into a team game!
You actually don't want to play as team.
There is just absolutely no trace of team spirit in any of the generic balance complaints that you guys are pumping out on a daily basis. It's all freaking garbage.
League of Legends has evolved a lot towards being more team focused and you just can't deal with it because you SUCK at teamwork.
This being said, go figure out why esports is getting so much shit as well. Why do we always see people talk about how "Riot only cares about pro players". No that's not what they do. They care about teamwork and pro players just happen to be exceptionally good at working togethe, whereas large parts of the solo queue players are focusing way too much on "solo carrying". But you forget that Teamwork is a skill too.

I don't know, having an ad carry to SOLO delete your entire team doesn't feel like a TEAM play. 
There are roles for everything. Supports' duty is to keep his adc safe and sound from enemy threats
Assassin is there to make their life difficuilt and delete their adc's as fast as possible with potentially getting out of there without dying
Tanks are there to be the hard frontline that rely on their Crowd Control so the enemy team is unable to react while the opposing team is fighting them
Bruisers are there to be frontline with medium survivability and medium damage, potentially have CC for smaller amount of enemies
Mages are there to deal damage mostly from medium / small range depending on the champion, with sustain or not
And then you see, if all of these roles actually WORKED, game would be enjoyable, as once used to be. Now, you just go ahead in a teamfight as lulu, hit R and shield for Tristana that's singlehandendly going to delete entire enemy team with a simple rocket jump, few AA's and maybe ult if she needs it. I don't call that teamwork. I call it individual broken thing. And i am talking about the high elo, not low elo. In low elo everything can carry if you're decent with the champion

I think that RIOT has made League toooooooo team based. Its why LCS games are boring as fuck to watch. It's all about scaling and getting items for these massive team fights that aren't even until 30-40 minutes into the game. The items and abilities have been tuned to that. Its annoying because in solo duo queue you have max 1 person you know (unless you're high ELO) and relying on 3-4 other people when you have little idea what they want to do and what their play style is so hoping to scale and do these team fights that require massive amount of communication isn't plausible. Pro play is an entirely different game and I don't think you can tune items, gameplay, champs, etc. for two different gameplays. Games have become a 5v5 fuck fest that whoever has the best AD carry wins unless some other champ snowballs out of control. Tell me the last game you've lost when you've had the better AD carry? It's just one broken thing to the next. Mid-End of S7 it was ardent censor making the AD carries broke as fuck, pre season to begin of S8 it was the Targons brace giving AD carries 2500-3000 hp making them non killable by assassins, now its normal broken to items that are severely under priced and overpowered. An AD carry can get 2 items that provide them with 80% crit. They have a 80% chance of doing 150% of their normal damage per AA.

One other thing is that junglers have too much gank pressure early. I used to jungle and most of the time the only thing to do is either gank or invade. I think thee should be less exp from camps, but they should respawn more often. This could also reward counter jungling at lower elos as the camps would be up more often (no requirement to time them) and thus give more Jungler vs. Jungler action.
